title: Relates to procurement of insurance coverage
summary: Relates to procurement of insurance coverage.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         3800

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 27, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to excess line brokers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subsection  (b)  of section 2118 of the insurance law, as
    2  amended by chapter 630 of the laws of 1988, paragraph 3  as  amended  by
    3  chapter  684  of  the  laws  of 1993, subparagraph (A) of paragraph 3 as
    4  amended by chapter 498 of the laws of 1996,  paragraph  7  as  added  by
    5  chapter 74 of the laws of 2001, and paragraphs 8 and 9 as added by chap-
    6  ter 687 of the laws of 2003, is amended to read as follows:
    7    (b)  (1) Within forty-five days after a policy is procured, a licensee
    8  shall submit the  declarations  page  or  cover  note  of  every  policy
    9  procured  under his or her license to the excess line association estab-
   10  lished pursuant to section two thousand one hundred thirty of this arti-
   11  cle for recording and stamping. In the event that no  declarations  page
   12  or cover note is available to the licensee, within forty-five days after
   13  the policy is procured, the licensee shall submit a binder to the excess
   14  line  association  in  lieu of such declarations page or cover note.  In
   15  the event that a binder is submitted to the excess line association, the
   16  licensee shall submit the declarations page or cover note to the  excess
   17  line association promptly upon receipt. Every insurance document submit-
   18  ted to the excess line association pursuant to this subsection shall set
   19  forth:
   20    (A) the name and address of the insured;
   21    (B) the gross premium charged;
   22    (C) the name of the unauthorized insurer; and
   23    (D) the kind of insurance procured.
   24    (2)  Subsequent  endorsements  which do not affect the premium charged
   25  are exempted from stamping.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05250-01-1

       A. 3800                             2

    1    (3) (A) The submission of insurance documents to the excess line asso-
    2  ciation shall be accompanied by a statement subscribed to, and  affirmed
    3  by,  the  licensee or sublicensee as true under the penalties of perjury
    4  that, after diligent effort, the full amount of insurance required could
    5  not  be  procured, from authorized insurers, each of which is authorized
    6  to write insurance of the kind requested  and  which  the  licensee  has
    7  reason  to  believe might consider writing the type of coverage or class
    8  of insurance involved, and further showing that the amount of  insurance
    9  procured from an unauthorized insurer is only the excess over the amount
   10  procurable  from  an authorized insurer. The licensee, however, shall be
   11  excused from affirming that a diligent effort,  as  defined  above,  was
   12  made  to procure the coverage from authorized insurers if the licensee's
   13  affidavit is accompanied by the affidavit of another broker involved  in
   14  the  placement  affirming  as  true under the penalties of perjury that,
   15  after diligent effort by the affirming broker,  the  required  insurance
   16  could  not  be  procured  from an authorized insurer which the affirming
   17  broker had reason to believe might consider writing the type of coverage
   18  or class of insurance involved. The licensee and  the  affirming  broker
   19  shall  be excused from affirming that a diligent effort was made (I) FOR
   20  TRANSACTIONS DEFINED IN SUBPARAGRAPH (F) OF THIS PARAGRAPH, OR  (II)  if
   21  the  superintendent  determines,  pursuant  to  paragraph  four  of this
   22  subsection, that no declinations are required.
   23    (B) A licensee or affirming broker shall be  considered  to  have  the
   24  reason  to believe required by subparagraph (A) of this paragraph if the
   25  decision to offer the risk to the authorized insurer was based on any of
   26  the following:
   27    (i) Recent acceptance by the authorized insurer of a type of  coverage
   28  or  class  of  insurance similar to that for which coverage is presently
   29  being sought;
   30    (ii) Advertising by the authorized insurer  or  its  agent  indicating
   31  that the authorized insurer is willing to consider acceptance of this or
   32  a similar type of coverage or class of insurance;
   33    (iii)  Media  communications  (i.e.,  newspaper  or magazine articles,
   34  trade publications, television and radio  programming)  indicating  that
   35  the  authorized insurer is writing, or is considering writing, this type
   36  of coverage or class of insurance;
   37    (iv) Communications with other insurance professionals, risk managers,
   38  trade associations, the excess line association or the insurance depart-
   39  ment, which indicates that the authorized insurer might consider writing
   40  this type of coverage or class of insurance; or
   41    (v) Any other valid basis for making such decision.
   42    (C) Every licensee, or affirming broker, in connection with the place-
   43  ment of each risk pursuant to this section, shall record on the  affida-
   44  vit required pursuant to subparagraph (A) of this paragraph the informa-
   45  tion  relied  upon that formed the basis of such licensee's or affirming
   46  broker's reason to believe that the authorized  insurer  might  consider
   47  writing the type of coverage or class of insurance involved.
   48    (D)  Declinations  obtained  from authorized insurers which are affil-
   49  iates of, or, as defined in  article  fifteen  of  this  chapter,  under
   50  common  control  with,  each other or the unauthorized insurer shall not
   51  meet the requirements of this subsection unless  such  related  insurers
   52  operate  as  distinct  and  autonomous  entities,  and  for underwriting
   53  purposes, compete with each other for the same type of coverage or class
   54  of insurance.
   55    (E) (I) The superintendent, in a  regulation,  may  determine  whether
   56  there are circumstances where it may be appropriate, due to the unavail-

       A. 3800                             3

    1  ability  from  an  authorized insurer of the leading type of coverage or
    2  the leading class of insurance required by the  insured,  to  waive  the
    3  requirement  in  subparagraph  (A) of this paragraph that a licensee may
    4  procure  from an unauthorized insurer only the amount of insurance which
    5  is excess over the amount procurable from an authorized insurer, and  to
    6  instead  permit the licensee to procure from an unauthorized insurer the
    7  full amount of insurance required by the insured.
    8    (II) ANY QUOTE FOR COVERAGE FROM AN AUTHORIZED INSURER WHERE THE GROSS
    9  PREMIUM EXCEEDS BY TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT OR MORE, A QUOTE  FOR  COMPARABLE
   10  COVERAGE  ACQUIRED BY AN EXCESS LINE BROKER MAY BE SUBMITTED AS A DECLI-
   11  NATION BY THE EXCESS LINE BROKER OR AFFIRMING BROKER.
   12    (F) NO DILIGENT EFFORT SHALL BE REQUIRED WHERE THE POLICY PROCURED:
   13    (I) INSURES A PUBLICLY TRADED ENTITY,
   14    (II) INSURES AN ENTITY WHICH PAYS AGGREGATE  ANNUAL  PREMIUMS  ON  ALL
   15  RISKS  TOTALING AT LEAST ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR POLICIES WRIT-
   16  TEN EXCLUSIVE OF PREMIUM FOR WORKERS' COMPENSATION AND HEALTH  INSURANCE
   17  BENEFITS,  EMPLOYS,  UTILIZES OR RETAINS A RISK MANAGER TO ASSIST IN THE
   18  NEGOTIATION AND PURCHASE OF A POLICY; AND  IN  ADDITION,  IN  ALL  CASES
   19  MEETS  ANY  ONE  OF  THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: HAS A NET WORTH OF AT LEAST
   20  TWENTY-FIVE MILLION DOLLARS, IS A FOR-PROFIT BUSINESS ENTITY THAT GENER-
   21  ATES ANNUAL GROSS REVENUES OF FIFTY MILLION DOLLARS, IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT
   22  ORGANIZATION  OR  PUBLIC  ENTITY  WITH  AN   ANNUAL   BUDGET   EXCEEDING
   23  TWENTY-FIVE  MILLION  DOLLARS  OR IS A MUNICIPALITY WITH A POPULATION OF
   24  NOT LESS THAN FIFTY THOUSAND PERSONS, OR
   25    (III) RENEWS A POLICY WITH THE SAME INSURER FOR A  SECOND  CONSECUTIVE
   26  ONE  YEAR  TERM,  OR  RENEWS THE POLICY FOR A THIRD CONSECUTIVE ONE YEAR
   27  TERM.
   28    (4) The number of declinations constituting diligent effort in  regard
   29  to  placement of coverage with authorized insurers for purposes of para-
   30  graph three of this subsection shall be three, unless (A)  THE  DILIGENT
   31  SEARCH  IS  EXCUSED  BY  SUBPARAGRAPH  (F)  OF  PARAGRAPH  THREE OF THIS
   32  SUBSECTION, OR (B) the superintendent after a hearing, on a record, upon
   33  findings and conclusions, determines that another number of such  decli-
   34  nations is appropriate in regard to particular coverages. In making such
   35  determinations, the superintendent shall consider relevant market condi-
   36  tions, including [unavailability of particular coverages from authorized
   37  insurers,  and may conduct market surveys] WHAT IS IN THE BEST INTERESTS
   38  OF INSUREDS SEEKING INSURANCE, THE NECESSITY FOR  MANUSCRIPTED  POLICIES
   39  WHERE  STANDARD FORMS ARE INADEQUATE OR UNAVAILABLE, FOSTERING INSURANCE
   40  PRODUCT INNOVATION AND DEVELOPMENT, AND WHERE PARTICULAR  COVERAGES  ARE
   41  NOT  REASONABLY  AND  WIDELY AVAILABLE.   THE SUPERINTENDENT MAY CONDUCT
   42  MARKET SURVEYS TO DETERMINE MARKET CONDITIONS.   Any such  determination
   43  shall be reviewed at least annually by the superintendent.
   44    (5)  Before placing business with an unauthorized insurer, each licen-
   45  see shall ascertain and verify the fact that such insurer is  authorized
   46  in  its  domiciliary jurisdiction to write the insurance policy proposed
   47  to be procured from it by the licensee. No unauthorized insurer shall be
   48  deemed unacceptable for placement of business solely on the ground  that
   49  it  has  been  so  authorized  to write such business in its domiciliary
   50  jurisdiction for a period of less than three years preceding the  place-
   51  ment  of  such risk by the licensee. In determining whether business may
   52  be placed with  such  unauthorized  insurer,  the  superintendent  shall
   53  consider such factors as: the interests of the public and policyholders,
   54  the  length  of time such insurer has been authorized in its domiciliary
   55  jurisdiction and elsewhere, its financial condition, and  unavailability
   56  of particular coverages from authorized insurers.

       A. 3800                             4

    1    (6)  It  shall  be  unlawful  for a licensee as defined in section two
    2  thousand one hundred one of this article and pursuant  to  sections  two
    3  thousand  one  hundred  four  and  two thousand one hundred five of this
    4  article to deliver in this state any declarations page of  an  insurance
    5  policy or cover note evidencing insurance unless such insurance document
    6  is  stamped  by  the  excess  line  association  or  is exempt from such
    7  requirements; provided, however, that a  licensee's  failure  to  comply
    8  with  the  requirements of this subsection shall not affect the validity
    9  of the coverage.
   10    (7) Compliance by a licensee with the requirements set forth  in  this
   11  section  in connection with submitting for recording and stamping decla-
   12  rations pages, cover notes, binders, endorsements,  affidavits,  notices
   13  of  excess  line placement and other excess line insurance documents may
   14  be accomplished by means of  electronic  or  other  media  transmission,
   15  provided  the  superintendent  first approves such methods of submitting
   16  for recording and stamping.
   17    (8) For purposes of this article, unless exempt under  the  provisions
   18  of  section two thousand one hundred seventeen of this article, a policy
   19  of insurance obtained from an insurer not authorized to  transact  busi-
   20  ness  in  this state must be procured pursuant to an excess line license
   21  when the entire property or risk exposure insured or any  part  thereof,
   22  is located in this state and:
   23    (A)  the  insured  negotiated to acquire the coverage from within this
   24  state; or
   25    (B) the policy was delivered to the insured in this state.
   26    (9) Nothing in this article shall prohibit  an  excess  line  licensee
   27  from placing risks under the excess or surplus line law of another state
   28  provided that the excess line licensee:
   29    (A) is licensed under the applicable state law as an excess or surplus
   30  line  broker  or  places  such risk through a licensed excess or surplus
   31  line broker in such state; and
   32    (B) either no portion of the property or  risk  exposure  is  in  this
   33  state,  or  the insured has property or risk exposure both in this state
   34  and in another state where the insured maintains a bona fide office from
   35  which it negotiated to acquire the coverage and to which the  policy  is
   36  delivered.
   37    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   38  have become a law; provided, however, that the amendments to  subsection
   39  (b) of section 2118 of the insurance law made by section one of this act
   40  shall  not  affect the expiration of such subsection and shall be deemed
   41  to expire therewith.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to excess line brokers
